title: Ticket #5668: Don't cache classad attributes that are pre-parsed
description:
When inserting attributes into a classad, the code can either take an unparsed string as input, or a pre-parsed ExprTree. Today, if we get an ExprTree, we first unparse it back to a string, in order to see if we have a cached value for that string. This is rather expensive, and unlikely to be a cache hit.

Instead, we will only cache inserts where we already have the string value to parse in hand.
remarks: no need for a version history for this one.
check_ins: 2016-May-09 16:05   Check-in [48376]: Don't cache classad attributes that are pre-parsed #5668 (By Greg Thain )
